website_summaries.verdict: A sound choice if you need pliers with crimping ability, although other choices may offer more versatility.
pros: High-carbon steel construction withstands heavy use
Ideal for electrical and wire tasks
cons: The quality of the finish doesn't match the strength of the tool
It also has a tendency to rust

customer_reviews.title: Sloppily made
customer_reviews.text: The crimpers that I received work OK but they have an ugly manufacturing flaw . There's a seam on the edge of the machined face of the tool just above the "Channellock" name that's jagged and has a sharp sliver hanging out . I can only describe it as ugly and sharp as a knife . I've bought many tools from many companies and have never seen something like this slip through quality control . I'm going to have to take it to the grinder so that it's safe to use . For the price I would expect much better . Not recommended .
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: (You just cannot beat Channellock brand tools. Was my original post.) But how after using them for a while I have found a few flaws. The place where you crimp insulated but connectors is to close to the cutting blade. So when you crimp the connector, the insulation gets cut through by the cutting blade. And the crimp notch for the insulated connectors will not go small enough to properly crimp the red connectors to 16 gage wire.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Chapin

customer_reviews.title: Effortlessly secure crimps every time
customer_reviews.text: I bought a fancy ratcheting crimping tool months ago because I wanted to step my wiring game up a notch. I was disappointed in the quality of the crimps that the expensive tool was producing. Not only that, but they weren't attractive either. I purchased this tool because I didn't trust the crimps of my expensive tool. I also purchased non-insulated butt connectors to go along with these. Using these with uninsulated butt connectors gives such a satisfying squish every single time. But wait, there's more! The crimps are SUPER solid for both uninsulated and insulated connectors. I will be using these instead of my expensive ratcheting crimp tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Quality Not What It Used To Be
customer_reviews.text: Hadn't owned these for more than a week before the cutting edge chipped and broke. They appear to be made from very brittle material- while cutting off a tab a big chunk of the cutting edge broke. Maybe my expectations are too high, and soft copper wire is all the tool should ever touch. But my past experience with Channellock brand tools has been much better than this. and I'm surprised and disappointed. I probably wouldn't buy the same tool again- time to explore options and find something that has better quality steel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Average quality at best. Had a pair I bought years ago and they were great but finally wore out. Just bought a pair of new ones and when I cut a piece of wire (standard house wire), they actually become off centered as they cut through the wire. You can feel it as it snips the wire in two. Kinda like a double snap. It's like the cutting edges go out of alignment when any pressure is exerted on them. I will spend more next and get a better quality brand than this. Sorry Channellock. You disappoint me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seized
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to have additional pairs of these crimping / stripping tool. 1st one worked well enough was a little tight, but brushed it off and thought it would get better over time. 2nd one was practically seized right out of the gate. Now, as of yesterday, the 1st one has seized as well. Both of them now require 2 handed operation with good force which is silly when you are using them on wire between 10 and 22 gauge.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Major Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed! I bought these to replace some cheap GB ones I’ve been using for a couple years. The jaws on these were not finished, almost like quality control is non existent and just shipped out the batches. I had to scrape the excess material off myself to make them work. I would not recommend these to anyone because it’s evident that whoever makes the crimping tools does not care about quality. I love their adjustable pliers and snap Ring pliers, which is why this came as such a big disappointment to me.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Simply the Best for Crimping
customer_reviews.text: For decades I have used the traditional multi-tool crimp/cut/strip tool, I never felt confident with the crimps tho. I usually tend to solder/heat shrink, but there are times you need butt/ring/spade connectors. Talked to a buddy that has done professional car audio installs for years, told me to buy a pair like this. Boy was he right, the leverage and ease is unmatched. These put a nice solid/flat crimp that will not come loose, don't even bother with the ratcheting ones. I had to do a bunch of audio wiring on my boat and these performed flawlessly!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good tool with an annonying detail.
customer_reviews.text: I had a set of pair of Klein Tools that I really liked but damaged by mistake. I ordered these thinking they would be great based on my experience all my other Channellock tools. Unfortuunately, while the cutting/stripping is great the tab that keeps them closed does not do a very good job. They come open while in storage or in my tool-belt which is very annoying. Overall an OK tool that will function but could have had better attention to details. I will go back to Klein Tools for my next pair.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: This will crimp the crap out of insulated and non insulated connectors equally well. Tight solid connection and it took some effort to pull these apart when I did a crimp test. Watch out for the sharp tip as to not cut into your hand. It can happen quite easily if you are working in a small space with little to no view of work area. It will getcha quick. This particular crimp tool didn't get me, but in my younger days starting off doing electrical stuff, it happened a time or two with an identical design cutting/crimp tool I had, so I add this for your well being. Happy crimping ...
customer_reviews.author: Gene Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Quality issues at Channellock?  C'mon guys, step it up!
customer_reviews.text: Quality isn't what I expected from Channellock. Jaws aren't ground straight, so the cutting surface is off a bit. The tip slso isn't aligned.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Spadowski

customer_reviews.title: Can't be beat.
customer_reviews.text: It takes a really good product for me to feel compelled to write a review. With that said, these are the best wire strippers out there right now. I install, service and repair fire alarms so this is a tool I use daily. I've tried other top brands (and a few not so top brands) and none compare. They are ridiculously sharp and super comfortable in your hands. I lost mine on a job 2 weeks ago and had to purchase another pair that arrived today. I've been using my back up Klein pair and I can't tell you how happy I am to be able to use my Channellock strippers at work tomorrow...
customer_reviews.author: Alan B Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great strippers
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a nice pair of strippers. They look to be a Ideal clone or a cousin since they might be made at the same place. A lot of pliers a few years back looked identical between these two brands aside from the handles. They have a nice and stiff lock and are completely closed when lock is engaged. Didn't use them yet but knowing Ideal strips like a champ and I own several Ideal strippers I am sure these will perform just as good. Great pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Nikola N.

customer_reviews.title: Junk.  Buy the Klein #1005 instead
customer_reviews.text: I lost my years-old Klein crimpers. I decided to buy this ChannelLock crimper. I didn't have an occasion to use it until recently. The jaws don't line up properly nor will it make a good crimp. The return period had passed, so I tossed this in the trash and spent the extra money to buy the Klein crimpers.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Scoutmaster

customer_reviews.title: Channellock (USA!) Quality, affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: Anyone that crimps on a daily/near daily basis will argue the need for a crimp-exclusive tool. The all-in-one wrie stripper/crimper/toaster oven/fax machines aren't made for constant use like you would find on a job site. Channellock quality plus made in USA makes these my go to crimper. there are other models that are more expensive and just as good, but this is priced great for home/job use. Some contractors prefer a beefier comfort grip like Klein or others offer, but I don't use these 24hrs a day, so the pros can have them.
customer_reviews.author: AngryDrumGuy

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA! Great design at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Made in USA! This tool is exactly what I was looking for. The placement of the various, cutting, stripping, and crimping functions are perfect. The wire puller at the tip is also great. Similar tools are not quite the same. They sometimes have the crimper and stripper reversed which to me seems like a poorly thought out design. Think of it like a nut cracker, they put the business end between the grips and pivot point. That's where you need the leverage to crimp easier too. Cutting and stripping shouldn't require a lot of leverage if you're using the tool right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Best of the many crimpers I have owned
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair. The first pair disappeared before I engraved my name on them. The second pair cut a live 120V feed on a two-way light circuit (in armored lead coated #12) and ruined (melted a big bite) out of the end cutter. In contrast to my red handled Klein's (sorta similar in shape), or the heavier Gardner Bender's, the Channellock's cut cleaner and feel better in my hand. I have other expensive crimpers with replaceable crimping inserts (make nice repeatable looking crimps) but for #8 and smaller, these fit into tighter spaces and get used more.
customer_reviews.author: J. Redding

customer_reviews.title: "Made in America"
customer_reviews.text: The fact that it's "Made in America" was my main reason to consider this tool, but also the design of the Channellock 909 has the "insulated" part of the crimp closer to the front of the jaws. It gives a nice tight crimp even on #10 insulated connectors...
customer_reviews.author: rw4x4van

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Hard to go wrong with Channel Lock tools. This is a great cutter/crimping tool. Not quite a Kline, but close enough considering the slight cost differential between the two. If you have to crimp an electrical connector, this is the tool to use. Heavy duty construction, feels good in the hands and the handles are plenty long enough to give you good leverage to ensure a tight crimp on the connector.
customer_reviews.author: wevsspot

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I had a nice pair of nippers that I loved but they didn't have the crimper. This has the crimper and so has replaced the old pair in my bucket as the go-to tool for electrical work and zip tie removal. If you do much wiring on a boat, you'll know how important zip tie cutters are. And if you do much 12v wiring these are great for solderless butt connectors. This is a quality tool. If I lost this pair I would buy the same one again.
customer_reviews.author: reedbr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for noninsulated crimps, not great for insulated crimps
customer_reviews.text: Solid tool for noninsulated crimps and a great price. This tool seems identical to the current iteration of the Ideal 30-429 for a lot less money. If attempting an insulated crimp, there is high probability that the insulation may get nicked by the back corner of the built in wirecutter. The Klein 1005 seems to do insulated crimps better because the noninsulated crimp area is not next to the cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Chen

customer_reviews.title: Durable and has the right stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Second purchase of this exact tool. The first one finally wore out but only at the 10/32 and 10/24 screw cutters after almost ten years of moderate use. This model and brand is only one of two I have been able to find that has the 10/32 and 10/24 screw cutters. The other brand was done after about 10 screw cuts. Will purchase again someday.
customer_reviews.author: Jess H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool.
customer_reviews.text: Top quality, made in the USA. I have recently given up buying cheap Chinese tools, which work poorly, break, wear out, get dull etc (inferior steel, lax tolerances). (Yes, I cheaped out but have learned my lesson.) This thing will go the distance. Very well made. Works perfectly. Sharp durable cutting edges, good crimping notches. Buy USA-made quality and pass it on to your kids.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph L.

customer_reviews.title: Buy It.
customer_reviews.text: Channellock puts out a quality tool. I like these over the Klein version because the portion of the crimper used to crimp insulated connectors is closer to the end of the jaw, which makes it easier to get into tight spaces. I work in the commercial HVAC-R field and some of these control boxes and refrigeration equipment run pretty tight on space, these work great. I'm a tool and gadget geek and over the last couple of years Channellock has really won me over with the quality of their tools.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey T Cahill

customer_reviews.title: Cutter has issues.
customer_reviews.text: Fairly solid tool. The front tool wont crimp "red connectors" tight enough when using a small wire... got to go to the back and then if your using shrink it will tend to put a hole in the shrink material. Also when you cut wire it makes the "blades" run past each other and then pops when you open it again. I should have spent a little more and got the Klein version. I had that one and lost it.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: A real tool that produces quality crimps.
customer_reviews.text: When you’re ready to stop playing with toys and start using real tools, buy these Channellock 909's. No nonsense, no color matching, just crimp, pull test and move on! With quality connectors you’ll get a strong crimp every time. The tool itself could last a lifetime with proper use and storage.
customer_reviews.author: Me Tell U

customer_reviews.title: My son likes these
customer_reviews.text: My son is a professional electrician and over time I have bought him CHANNELLOCK electrical tools as gifts for various holidays and he just loves CHANNELLOCK tools. He said he wouldn't use anything else, and he's tried other brands over the years. He has the whole set on his belt now. I'll have to find something else for holiday's.
customer_reviews.author: Mark in Pa.

customer_reviews.title: Really love these strippers
customer_reviews.text: Really love these strippers. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 was that the latch to keep them closed always slips open. A lot of the guys I work with rip off the the locking latch anyway. I’m one of the few that actually like having it on (I usually always have the Klein curved handle strippers) but with these I had to rip it off cuz I just got annoyed with it not working. Other than that they strip well and feel great in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Halvy

customer_reviews.title: Great wire stripers
customer_reviews.text: These wire strippers work great. Easy to hold. Cut perfectly. I have been impressed with all of the Channellock tools that I have purchased and now always look at their brand first when I need a new tool.
customer_reviews.author: EL

customer_reviews.title: Car Audio Must Haves
customer_reviews.text: Working in car audio you need more than one crimper, I bought a pair and then bought one from Snap-On and I ended up using the Channel Lock crimper more than the Sanp-On one. The Snap-On crimpers were more comfortable but the Channel Lock have a wider opening. Unfortunately I lost both the Snap-On and Channel Lock crimpers, I ended up ordering the Channel Locks and for 20 dollars you will not find a better pair.
customer_reviews.author: Ramiro Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: DIdnt know what i was missing till i got these!
customer_reviews.text: Always kept having to recrimp (if that's how you spell it) when I used other brand crimpers. These always have a perfect crimp and make it easy. I hated doing auto electrical on my truck since it took a while to make a clean electrical connection job, but these crimpers speed up the process big time and make the process more enjoyable and more of a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

customer_reviews.title: Channellock 958 6-1/4-Inch Wire Stripper and Cutter
customer_reviews.text: -have been using these for years, good product; simple, small, easy to use, has a lock so they're not springing open... these and the channellock 911 cable cutters are hard to beat... you can pay more, but in the long run these are the winners (price vs length of use)
customer_reviews.author: jcc

customer_reviews.title: Expensive But Quality Made
customer_reviews.text: I worked wiring hoses when I was in school and had a set of these, that was in 1977-78. It is good to see the same quality went into these that was in them years ago. You can but cheaper, but not a better value. These will last.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Kimbrough

customer_reviews.title: My second favorite strippers
customer_reviews.text: My favorite strippers can't be kept in the shop, not without risking the ire of my wife anyway. These are nice quality. Bought to replace another brand that appear nearly identical but perform less well. For the money, it's hard to go wrong with Channellock. Mostly I've been using them on 22-14 gauge wire and they strip flawlessly. My only suggestion for improvement would be a slightly thicker handle.
customer_reviews.author: R.A.M.Top Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Channelock Quality and good design
customer_reviews.text: Channellock have been making tools for decades, and the new ones are just as well made as the older ones. They may cost a bit more, but they'll last generations. I still have some of my father's Channelocks, and they work just as well as the day he bought them. These strippers are well designed, and also have a crimper which makes them even handier. Big enough handles to provide good leverage and comfortable grip without being unnecessarily large. One complaint: I wish they went up to at least an 8 AWG, 6 would be even better.
customer_reviews.author: Dave2001

customer_reviews.title: Throw away the flat style and buy these
customer_reviews.text: Seriously throw away the flat style crimper and get these. So much better, the crimp is perfect and dosen't cut the insulation. For the money these are a good value considering how well they work.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Purser

customer_reviews.title: Super Crimping Tool Made in the USA!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these, I bought another pair because I have worn out the cutting tip. I did resharpen it a few times, mainly because I use these for more than just cutting and crimping. However I ONLY use Channellock for my pliers, cutters, needle nose and others. They are made in the USA and the quality of them speaks miles. I would highly recommend them especially anyone who deals with electronics and/or wiring and crimping a lot.
customer_reviews.author: ALL4SPL

customer_reviews.title: Great pliers
customer_reviews.text: I've bought the entire Channellock lineup for electricians pliers and wire strippers. Work as intended. Have a good weight and build to them. Plus Channellock is still made in US. Great product, competitively priced and Made in US.
customer_reviews.author: Maurice Gerardo

customer_reviews.title: Well built made in USA tool. Beefy like channelock lineman's pliers.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't got to use them yet but they are beefy and I know they will work great.... I just ordered a pair of knipex linemans with built in crimpers as well, or else Id buy a second pair of these because they are so well built. The best crimpers on the market right now are Channelock, Klein and Knipex in my opinion. Anything german or USA made is great.
customer_reviews.author: Electrical Fluke

customer_reviews.title: has been handle all the gauges I've thrown at it - from 14 gauge lamp cord to CAT6 ethernet cable - these are great -
customer_reviews.text: Being the goof that I am ... I keep loosing these ... ya ... I know ... I should have small toolbox to keep these types of tools handy ... but ... get back to the actual tool itself - Channel Lock ... the quality is right there - front & center ... no issues with anything about this tool - has been handle all the gauges I've thrown at it - from 14 gauge lamp cord to CAT6 ethernet cable - these are great -
customer_reviews.author: Canadian Gypsy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I’ve made in a while I use them every single day my coworker loves it just as much very well made cuts very well all around great tool will recommend to anyone in need of crimpers
customer_reviews.author: skinnyblack

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I had initially purchased HF ratcheting crimpers but they just didn't work well. These arrived within 2 days, and I immediately got to work. This is a single crimp application tool but you can just go back and apply another crimp to increase the strength of the bond if you like. Very happy with this simple tool.
customer_reviews.author: k_bock

customer_reviews.title: I like them for light automotive use.  Works very well as an all in one.
customer_reviews.text: I try to buy everything Made in USA. For the price you cannot beat them. Some people say the cutter is no good for large with. I agree with the statement but remember these are "wire" cutters not "cable" cutters. I like the cutter being in front. I've had better shearing tools but at a much higher price. Come on... it's $20!! I use them in my travel mechanic bag so I don't cry if I lose them. Great for Christmas gift!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good crimper and good tool to have
customer_reviews.text: It's a good tool but it needs to be more durable I use it for my job doing fire surpression systems every day and it's not very durable the cutter on both ends is worthless when it just pinched the wire instead of cutting the wire I'd buy it again but I'd customize it like I've done the one I have
customer_reviews.author: cole watson

customer_reviews.title: Great crimpers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pair after i bought and broke the Irwin vice grip crimping tool. I should have known to buy the original channel lock brand. This brand has been around forever and never lets me down.
customer_reviews.author: 12gaugethumpin

customer_reviews.title: These work great... have used them for years!
customer_reviews.text: To say it simply.... Channellock makes some of the best tools at reasonable price points! I have never owned a Channellock tool that I did not like! Cheaper Chinese type strippers are cast and do not strip as well. These have precise and sharp stripping teeth that work exactly the way this design was meant too. Plus these last for many years! I am ordering this one because I have lost a set... not because the old one wore out or broke. FYI. So if you are considering a no name brand then reconsider.... for a few bucks more you can have the real deal! 5 Stars for a great product at a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: John I. Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: "If everyone used these crimps I would be out of business" because he gets crap tons a return repairs
customer_reviews.text: I had a guy who runs an electrical business for re-salvaged vehicles and motorcycles tell me, "If everyone used these crimps I would be out of business" because he gets crap tons a return repairs. So far after a few months of daily use they are troopers and i love them you can tell the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby L. Swagger

customer_reviews.title: Built in the USA and works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a review writer, so for something to motivated me to write a review, it's exceded my expectations. The crimping tool arrived a day early, and I put it to work soon after. The cutting tip performed well and allowed a nice clean cut of stripped wires to get them at the correct length and angle. The crimping section of the tool crimped nicely without injury to the heat shrink insulation. Worked very well in the tight snug area under the dash where I was working. Should buy a spare set because this is a tool I don't want to go without! Now if I can find a wire stripper I like this much, I'll be set!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Gader

customer_reviews.title: great tool...
customer_reviews.text: better than crimpers that have multi holes for stripping wire that distort when substantial force is applied. this doesn't strip wire but has great leverage to make a secure connection and is solid as all channellock hand tools. i always opt for a tool made in the USA such as this when i have a clear choice.
customer_reviews.author: racer17

customer_reviews.title: An old friend....
customer_reviews.text: Been using these forever. The design hasn’t changed in 40 years Always worked when I needed to step wire. The screw cutter comes in handy too. Just keep it oiled and it will last. Made in USA.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought these years ago
customer_reviews.text: I've been using wire strippers that have the crimper part in the handle. These are way easier to use, especially in tight spots, or short wire. I use both hands to really crimp it down good.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri Bullock

customer_reviews.title: Top quality tool
customer_reviews.text: Pro water well driller here. I have been buying Klein crimpers exclusively for years. These are same quality, a bit different configuration but just as easy to use. I use them frequently with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool!
customer_reviews.text: A must have whether you're a master electrician or a handy man, if you're tired of cheap wire crimpers that you can pull the terminal off than you need these!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: feels cheap plastic grip, arrived with the rust on it
customer_reviews.text: feels cheap plastic grip, arrived with the rust on it, can imagine how it will look later. i'd skip it. would have returned it if i could. waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: c g

customer_reviews.title: Great quality crimpers!
customer_reviews.text: The first pair of wire crimpers I ever owned was channellock, so when I lost my last pair, buying these was a no brainer. They're great for stripping wires and crimping connectors, both insulated and non-insulated. The handles feel pretty comfortable and they are very durable. Hopefully I won't lose this pair anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: fbrglzdrmz

customer_reviews.title: A good, inexpensive stripper
customer_reviews.text: The Channellock 958 6-1/4-Inch Wire Stripper has close-fitting jaws, unlike the last two electrical-supplier brand strippers I had purchased at the Big Box home improvement stores, and the spring-loaded handles are easier to work with than the "fingers on the outside, with one or two in between the handles to open the strippers after each strip (or retry)" models. A good, inexpensive stripper.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Allison

customer_reviews.title: love these
customer_reviews.text: entirely too well built for the meager usage I give this tool. I definitely see a professional being able to abuse this for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: Had 3 wire strippers prior to this one and I wish I spent the money earlier and the first time and just bought Channellock. Well worth the money and the quality is great. no issues with it and would defiantly buy again
customer_reviews.author: sweatyyetti

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased with the ease in which this tool sized, cut, and stripped wire. It made wiring jobs more accurate and much easier. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spend just a little bit more and get something that works a lot better
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this but I was let down. The surface finish is pretty poor and the tolerances aren’t great. The cutters work well but the crimping jaws are just awkward and don’t hold connectors very well. I thought I’d save $10 and get these instead of the Kleins but I wish I hadn’t. Right now the Kleins are actually only $5 more. Get those.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Generally one of the best!
customer_reviews.text: At my work we use these for crimping terminals. They are usually a great work-horse of the place. We depend heavily on them. Occasionally they crap out a little prematurely such as the one pictured. Something has gone awry at the pivot joint and now it won't close straight. This occurred at least 100 hours into its use. Despite its imperfections, these are a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: What are you waiting for buy this now!
customer_reviews.text: Had mine for about a year, there is a little surface rust (im in California not sure what that's about) , these are really well made they cut better than any cuter i have used before and they crimp like butter, im spoiled i can never go back to the cheap ones (i had to use some the other day man like night and day).
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to use just one hand
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these to use for stereo installation. Open the package pull them out and they were too stiff to use with one hand. Tried to wear them in even attempted to oil but nothing seems to loosen them up still extremely hard to use. The last crimp tool I purchased was in 92 and I still have them to this day just wanted a new one. guess I’ll have to go back to the old one they work much better
customer_reviews.author: Art Monroe

customer_reviews.title: One of my go to’s for wiring; arcade builds, stereos
customer_reviews.text: Great for car stereo installation arcade game builds/wiring. Same model i used in the 90s in my teens installing stereos. Just feels right in my hand compared to the walmart etc ones. Well made, precise in wire cutting and crimping. One of my go to’s for any electrical wiring. Lasts too, had my last one for over 15 years, til i lost it. Wont lose this one!
customer_reviews.author: Time is an illusion

customer_reviews.title: The quality is so - so. Theyll work, ...
customer_reviews.text: The quality is so - so . Theyll work, and then when they wear out I will throw them away. When you lock the handle, it then re opens about half way. What a joke. Cant they at least remove all of the play in lock?
customer_reviews.author: MGS172

customer_reviews.title: They work. That's what matters
customer_reviews.text: Fairly comfortable and crimps great. Only used twice so far. But I expect them to last especially at twenty dollars or more.
customer_reviews.author: master Irrigator

customer_reviews.title: Tight crimp
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic wire crimping plyers.After yrs of other offbeat brands.Found these after using my brothers others.Tight crimp first time easy to use in tight places
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey stephens

customer_reviews.title: Great Crimpers
customer_reviews.text: I love Channellock tools. It's hard to find tools made in the USA and these were exactly what I was looking for to add to my collection of tools.
customer_reviews.author: Davidson94

customer_reviews.title: Great Pliers at a value
customer_reviews.text: These are tight joined heavily built and feel good in the hand. They are well made and a steal for the $.
customer_reviews.author: Klayton Porter

customer_reviews.title: Ended my frustration with multi use crimpers.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, fit the hand well, and put good pressure on the connectors. A big improvement ver the multi-use crimpers.
customer_reviews.author: John M Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Same quality even after 15 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for my boss after he broke his pair he had been using daily for 15 years. The reason they finally broke was because he had rounded out the crimper with an grinder so he could crimp 8 gauge terminals. They finally cracked right where he had ground it out. When I handed him the new pair, he was amazed that they felt exactly the same as the one he had had for some many years. I think this says a lot about Channellocks quality if they can hold up to 15 years of daily abuse. Not to mention they cost a fifth of what a new set of snap-on crimpers do!
customer_reviews.author: Octavius

customer_reviews.title: Good, tough USA-made tool.
customer_reviews.text: This isn't the cheapest, but it's in my professional toolbox in the shop, and never has failed to work. Excellent for crimping fairly large wire connectors.
customer_reviews.author: Hendrik A. Mills

customer_reviews.title: The best wire strippers on market
customer_reviews.text: Just like I remember my dad used to give me to use they work so much better than Chinese product of the same use I mean they actually sharpen them and actual size various wires sharpen perfectly The coating on Wire slips effortlessly off making me look towards the sky thank God I'm in America and this product says Made in the USA I can feel it
customer_reviews.author: D fresh

customer_reviews.title: Buy Kleins.... these suck
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these crimpers. Im an IBEW electrician. First crimp on some copper wire was a complete fail. When you actually try crimping an insulated fork or ring terminal, the crimping part actually pushes it right into the cutting part of the tool. Piss poor design. Buy a Klein
customer_reviews.author: AK49Chewelah

customer_reviews.title: Another solid Channellock tool made in USA! Invaluable if ...
customer_reviews.text: Another solid Channellock tool made in USA! Invaluable if you do any automotive wiring work, particularly installing any aftermarket devices. For example, I've used these to install emergency lights/sirens in emergency vehicles. If you need to crimp any connectors, this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher N.

customer_reviews.title: GRRRREAT!!!!!!!!  ELECTRICAL PLIERS!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this Channellock for two main reasons: One, made in USA and the Channellock quality control. If you are working in the Electronic anr/or the Electrical Field this is the best pair of wiring pliers on the market. I remember in my Electrical Classes how many students wanted to use my pliers(it was very many). These pliers have an excellent feel in my hands. If you want an excellent pair of pliers than look no further and get the Channellocks!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Simple, does what it's suppose to do
customer_reviews.text: If you need an inexpensive no frills wire stripper, then you found it. Works great for what it is. It lacks any kind of crimping mechanism except for the very tip which might work in a pinch. I found it necessary to upgrade to a pair that has more features, such as dedicated crimpers and screw cutting abilities. If I had to do it over again I'd forgo this pair and get the second pair with more features. ***ETA*** This review was for the six inch pliers. Amazon really shouldn't try and mix the two products' reviews. Experience level in relation to this tool: medium-low
customer_reviews.author: MissississississippiMan

customer_reviews.title: The most versatile wiring tool for my preferences.
customer_reviews.text: Channellock is great quality and value. Love these so much, I bought a 2nd one for the RV. I appreciate the nose pliers on the tip and crimp area in the back. Works excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Brewskii

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be.
customer_reviews.text: Cutting edge worthless after 5 months, hand grips slipping off. Channel Lock used to be a quality tool name but seems they have lost their way in quality. Sad to see a brand I used to love fall from grace. Spend your money elsewhere if you use your tools daily.
customer_reviews.author: corey

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: I have used this tool on several occasions for stripping and cutting wire (no crimping jobs yet). It has held up and works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Mizer

customer_reviews.title: Well made with lots of leverage for serious crimps
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome for up to 10-12 gauge connectors. Significantly more leverage and better crimps than the cheaper and more common stripper/crimpers that you see at hardware stores and "junk tool" stores like HF.
customer_reviews.author: MikeB

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as everything else from Channel Lock
customer_reviews.text: Probably not as secure as a ratcheting crimper, but for the typical 18-12awg terminals you're likely to run across, these work great. Pair them with an automatic wire stripper for a solution that's a lot better than those all-in-one tools, but still easy on your tool budget.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: I never liked this style of stripper, but this is nice
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit, I like these more now than my simple stripper, and crimper set now
customer_reviews.author: hi-c

customer_reviews.title: These work great
customer_reviews.text: They crimp tight. The crimps hold good. They are the best crimpers I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: D. Darling

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of Channellock because of their high metal quality, and this shows with these wire strippers. The only negative about this product are the handles. They are small, non-ergonomic, and the rubber molding should be designed in a way that there is cushion. Check out the Klein 11055 if you do not understand what I am talking about. Still very satisfied with this product. Channellock makes good stuff. 4/5 Stars
customer_reviews.author: David Bryant

customer_reviews.title: 👍
customer_reviews.text: Little big for my hand, but I make them work. The size of the handle does allow for great crimping!
customer_reviews.author: Jolie Woodard

customer_reviews.title: Channelock tools are durable and well made.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, well designed hand tool for crimping or cutting wire, bailing wire, etc... well made and durable. Terrific construction and handle grip. Can’t live without at least one pair.
customer_reviews.author: Terry McAdams

customer_reviews.title: Great Crimper
customer_reviews.text: This tool does a much nicer, more secure job of crimping connectors than the multi-tool that I also have. As another reviewer stated, you can use the non-insulated on insulated, but it may pierce the insulation (that's what electrical tape is for), and you can use the close end right by the pivot point to get a really tight fit. These are well made and have a nice cutter.
customer_reviews.author: BorisMD

customer_reviews.title: 1# quality
customer_reviews.text: Highest quality tool you’d expect from American made channelock brand, price here on Amazon can’t be beat
customer_reviews.author: Dennis R

customer_reviews.title: Well made and do the job well
customer_reviews.text: Very well made (in USA to boot) and seems to be excellent quality. Jaws line up well and it makes good, consistent crimps. A significant step up from using the combo cutter/stripper/crimper tools. I've had a set of Channelock wire cutters for years, and they are always what I reach for in my toolbox even though I have a few other brands. I'm expecting to get the same amount of service from these crimpers.
customer_reviews.author: BrianW

customer_reviews.title: Well built and solid crimps. Cutter is precise and does clean cuts.
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to a crimping tool between these gauges, I see either these or Klein's being used and both are highly praised. These we're $10 cheaper so I went with these, you put a lot of pressure with these and it'll crimp good without breaking...just don't try to crimp 4 gauge connectors or something. The cutters on these are so useful, pretty much my main tool for cutting stuff. I only use the non-insulated part even on insulated connectors ( i noticed thats what everyone does ).
customer_reviews.author: andre

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: These have nice long handles making crimping connections a breeze. 10/10 would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great tools.
customer_reviews.text: Channel lock tooks among the best,,,,very happy. Home Depot didn't have this on display.
customer_reviews.author: Charles B. Stauffer

customer_reviews.title: A great tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: After using a multi wire stripper tool for years that I got from a nationwide radio chain back when I was in high school (I'm almost 40 now), this tool is a complete god send! I'm not a professional or anything but do do my share of things like creating my own speaker wires to custom lengths and other home theater and stereo tasks around the house. This is so fun, more comfortable and easier to use than my prior one. The handle plastic is not sliding off like the old tool either. I threw the old one away and was happy to do so. after getting this.
customer_reviews.author: Mediahound 🎧

customer_reviews.title: Excellent crimpers at a great price
customer_reviews.text: These are a must-have tool if you work with spade lugs, ring lugs, and butt-splices. They are very good quality and less expensive than the T&B versions. I would expect them to last for decades of daily use. I cut some steel wire that I should have used my lineman pliers to cut and it didn't nick the cutting edge. I'm impressed. These are my second and third pair. I keep them in my toolbox and each vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce C.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. I work in the HVAC service field and the reliability and durability is very important to me and my quality of my service work
customer_reviews.author: RICARD DESROCHERS

customer_reviews.title: These are a great pair of wire strippers/crimpers
customer_reviews.text: These are a great pair of wire strippers/crimpers. The fit of the two halves is perfect. i have no problems cutting or stripping wires with the indicated sizes or sometimes even out of that range. I particularly like the grips, they have a little give to them which makes using them over the course of the day more comfortable than comparable pairs I have used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan A.

customer_reviews.title: Crimpers don't crimp
customer_reviews.text: The wire stripper part of the tool works great....BUT the crimpers don't crimp....It is not a matter of applying more pressure, even when fully closed there is a space between the two sides of the crimper so wires are not secured in the connectors...Useless....tried on the job and returned after first day...I'm going with Klein.
customer_reviews.author: scott e.

customer_reviews.title: Even though these are nice cutter/crimpers that I use seldom they are really rusting ...
customer_reviews.text: Even though these are nice cutter/crimpers that I use seldom they are really rusting pretty bad from the pivot joint out. I'm not sure how well they stand behind their product but I would like to know please. Thank you, Tom
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Sharp easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I havent had too many others to compare it to. I have been using a linemans to strip for years, then I finally got a decent brand one and I lost it a while back. This tool is sharp and makes work much easier. When installing full panels and such its saves loads of time, especially in tight spots where you dont have much place to use force.
customer_reviews.author: Avrohom

product_meta.title: Channellock 909 9.5-Inch Wire Crimping Tool | Electrician's Terminal Crimp Pliers with Cutter are Designed for Insulated and Non-Insulated Connections | Forged from High Carbon Steel | Laser Heat-Treated Edges Last Longer | Made in the USA
product_meta.description:
Size:9.5-Inch Crimper/CutterThe Channellock 909 9-1/2-Inch Crimping Plier has a sleek nose design gets into tight places and a laser heat-treated mating edge makes this the only crimper you'll ever need. Perfect for both insulated and non-insulated solderless connections and terminals.

AMAZON.COM


Designed for crimping of both insulated and non-insulated solderless connections and terminals, the Channellock 909 Crimping Tool with Cutter features a sleek nose design that gets into tight places and a laser heat-treated mating edge makes this the only crimper you'll ever need. It's perfect for both insulated and non-insulated solderless connections and terminals.

Designed to facilitate efficient crimping of wires (view larger). Channellock uses high carbon C1080 steel for superior performance on the job, and it's completed by Channellock's iconic blue handle, which is both comfortable in your hand and easy to spot in your tool bag.

SPECIFICATIONS
Overall length 9.5 inches Jaw length 1.16 inches Joint thickness 0.48-inch Handle span 1.89 inches Cutting edge 0.43-inch Joint width 1.32 inches Weight 0.94 pounds ABOUT CHANNELLOCK
Founded in 1886, Channellock is a worldwide leader in the manufacture of high-quality pliers and assorted hand tools. Now run by the fifth generation of the DeArment family, Channellock tools reflect a tradition of dedication to excellence maintained for well over a century. Over the years, Channellock has obtained several patents including one in 1965 for the conical surface created on the cam side of the pliers when undercut and another in 1984 for the PermaLock fastener found in its Tongue and Groove Pliers. Channellock still manufactures more than 120 different sizes and types of pliers and hand tools at its facilities in Meadville, Pennsylvania.

909 CRIMPING TOOL WITH CUTTER
AT A GLANCE
 * Crimps and cuts insulated and non-insulated solderless connections and terminals
 * Cuts 10-22 AWG wire
 * Constructed of high-carbon C1080 steel for superior performance
 * Iconic blue handle is comfortable and easy to spot in your tool bag 
 * Made in USA


See larger image. 

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Channellock Crimping Tool with Cutter is designed to facilitate efficient crimping of wires. It is made from high carbon drop-forged steel and offers long lasting durability.

See more
